title: Problem 2134_C
statement: An array is called good if, for every subarray^{\text{∗}} of length at least 2, the sum of the elements at even indices (with respect to the original array) is greater than or equal to the sum of the elements at odd indices. Array indexing starts from 1.For example, the arrays [3,8,4,4] and [2,3,1,4,2] are good.
